00054 /**************************************************************************/
00062 __STATIC_INLINE void CHIP_Init(void)
00063 {
00064 #if defined(_EFM32_GECKO_FAMILY)
00065   uint32_t                    rev;
00066   SYSTEM_ChipRevision_TypeDef chipRev;
00067   volatile uint32_t           *reg;
00068 
00069   rev = *(volatile uint32_t *)(0x0FE081FC);
00070   /* Engineering Sample calibration setup */
00071   if ((rev >> 24) == 0)
00072   {
00073     reg   = (volatile uint32_t *)0x400CA00C;
00074     *reg &= ~(0x70UL);
00075     /* DREG */
00076     reg   = (volatile uint32_t *)0x400C6020;
00077     *reg &= ~(0xE0000000UL);
00078     *reg |= ~(7UL << 25);
00079   }
00080   if ((rev >> 24) <= 3)
00081   {
00082     /* DREG */
00083     reg   = (volatile uint32_t *)0x400C6020;
00084     *reg &= ~(0x00001F80UL);
00085     /* Update CMU reset values */
00086     reg  = (volatile uint32_t *)0x400C8040;
00087     *reg = 0;
00088     reg  = (volatile uint32_t *)0x400C8044;
00089     *reg = 0;
00090     reg  = (volatile uint32_t *)0x400C8058;
00091     *reg = 0;
00092     reg  = (volatile uint32_t *)0x400C8060;
00093     *reg = 0;
00094     reg  = (volatile uint32_t *)0x400C8078;
00095     *reg = 0;
00096   }
00097 
00098   SYSTEM_ChipRevisionGet(&chipRev);
00099   if (chipRev.major == 0x01)
00100   {
00101     /* Rev A errata handling for EM2/3. Must enable DMA clock in order for EM2/3 */
00102     /* to work. This will be fixed in later chip revisions, so only do for rev A. */
00103     if (chipRev.minor == 00)
00104     {
00105       reg   = (volatile uint32_t *)0x400C8040;
00106       *reg |= 0x2;
00107     }
00108 
00109     /* Rev A+B errata handling for I2C when using EM2/3. USART0 clock must be enabled */
00110     /* after waking up from EM2/EM3 in order for I2C to work. This will be fixed in */
00111     /* later chip revisions, so only do for rev A+B. */
00112     if (chipRev.minor <= 0x01)
00113     {
00114       reg   = (volatile uint32_t *)0x400C8044;
00115       *reg |= 0x1;
00116     }
00117   }
00118   /* Ensure correct ADC/DAC calibration value */
00119   rev = *(volatile uint32_t *)0x0FE081F0;
00120   if (rev < 0x4C8ABA00)
00121   {
00122     uint32_t cal;
00123 
00124     /* Enable ADC/DAC clocks */
00125     reg   = (volatile uint32_t *)0x400C8044UL;
00126     *reg |= (1 << 14 | 1 << 11);
00127 
00128     /* Retrive calibration values */
00129     cal = ((*(volatile uint32_t *)(0x0FE081B4UL) & 0x00007F00UL) >>
00130            8) << 24;
00131 
00132     cal |= ((*(volatile uint32_t *)(0x0FE081B4UL) & 0x0000007FUL) >>
00133             0) << 16;
00134 
00135     cal |= ((*(volatile uint32_t *)(0x0FE081B4UL) & 0x00007F00UL) >>
00136             8) << 8;
00137 
00138     cal |= ((*(volatile uint32_t *)(0x0FE081B4UL) & 0x0000007FUL) >>
00139             0) << 0;
00140 
00141     /* ADC0->CAL = 1.25 reference */
00142     reg  = (volatile uint32_t *)0x40002034UL;
00143     *reg = cal;
00144 
00145     /* DAC0->CAL = 1.25 reference */
00146     reg  = (volatile uint32_t *)(0x4000402CUL);
00147     cal  = *(volatile uint32_t *)0x0FE081C8UL;
00148     *reg = cal;
00149 
00150     /* Turn off ADC/DAC clocks */
00151     reg   = (volatile uint32_t *)0x400C8044UL;
00152     *reg &= ~(1 << 14 | 1 << 11);
00153   }
00154 #endif
00155 
00156 #if defined(_EFM32_GIANT_FAMILY)
00157   uint32_t                    rev;
00158   SYSTEM_ChipRevision_TypeDef chipRev;
00159 
00160   rev = *(volatile uint32_t *)(0x0FE081FC);
00161   SYSTEM_ChipRevisionGet(&chipRev);
00162 
00163   if (((rev >> 24) > 15) && (chipRev.minor == 3))
00164   {
00165     /* This fixes an issue with the LFXO on high temperatures. */
00166     *(volatile uint32_t*)0x400C80C0 =
00167                       ( *(volatile uint32_t*)0x400C80C0 & ~(1<<6) ) | (1<<4);
00168   }
00169 #endif
00170 
00171 #if defined(_EFM32_HAPPY_FAMILY)
00172   uint32_t rev;
00173   rev = *(volatile uint32_t *)(0x0FE081FC);
00174 
00175   if ((rev >> 24) <= 129)
00176   {
00177     /* This fixes a mistaken internal connection between PC0 and PC4 */
00178     /* This disables an internal pulldown on PC4 */
00179     *(volatile uint32_t*)(0x400C6018) = (1 << 26) | (5 << 0);
00180     /* This disables an internal LDO test signal driving PC4 */
00181     *(volatile uint32_t*)(0x400C80E4) &= ~(1 << 24);
00182   }
00183 #endif
00184 
00185 #if defined(_SILICON_LABS_32B_PLATFORM_2)
00186 #if defined(DEBUG_EFM)
00187   /* Remove reset survival lock on CMU in debug mode */
00188   CMU->LOCK = CMU_LOCK_LOCKKEY_UNLOCK | (1UL << 31);
00189 #endif
00190 #endif
00191 }
00192 
00196 #ifdef __cplusplus
00197 }
00198 #endif
00199 
00200 #endif /* __SILICON_LABS_EM_CHIP_H__ */
